intro: Zeuxine stricta, commonly known as the slender zeuxine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. Zeuxine stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
